ETYMOLOGY: From Old French comment (noun) and commenter (verb), derived from Latin commentum (interpretation, note, invention), the neuter past participle of comminisci ('to devise, invent')

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A verbal or written remark expressing an opinion or reaction.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She refused to make any comment until she had all the facts.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 在她掌握所有事实之前，她拒绝发表任何评论。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To express an opinion or reaction; to make a remark.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The manager commented favorably on the team's performance.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 经理对团队的表现给予了正面的评价。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A non-executable note included in programming code or documentation to explain specific sections or functions.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: (计算机) 注释；程序中的说明。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Always add a comment explaining why you chose this specific algorithm.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 一定要添加注释来解释你选择这个特定算法的原因。
